document_data.name: Aghul Balai
document_data.mainbody: '''Aghul Balai''' was a member of the [[Tsu-tsu]] tribe of the [[Plain of Horses]] in the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]]. He was a follower and Chung Tao of [[the Way]].
document_data.History:
Aghul had studied for many years in [[Shou Lung]] to learn the secrets of the Way.

In [[1359 DR]], Aghul Balai was among the teachers, magical advisors, and agents of Second Empress [[Bayalun]] of the [[Tuigan]] at [[Quaraband]]. Aghul sought to convert Bayalun to the Way. Bayalun briefly introduced him to the lama envoy [[Koja]].
document_data.Description: Aghul was elderly, thin, and wizened in appearance. He wore faded yellow silk robes covered with [[Shou Chiang|Shou characters]].
